definition: Very old; belonging to a time long past.
examples: We studied ancient civilisations in history.
An ancient tree shaded the village green.

definition: A period of one hundred years.
examples: The castle was built in the 12th century.
A new century began in the year 2000.

definition: A room, especially a special or private one; a space inside a machine or body.
examples: The council met in the main chamber.
Blood flows through the heart’s chambers.

extra.memory_tip: Chamber = a contained space for people or things.

definition: To go down from a higher place to a lower one.
examples: We descended the steep stairs carefully.
Fog descended over the harbour.

definition: The act of going in; a doorway or gate; an item written in a list or diary.
examples: Tickets are required for entry.
I wrote today’s entry in my journal.

extra.memory_tip: Entry = where you enter or what you enter (in a book).

definition: The inside part of something; relating to the inside.
examples: The car’s interior is very spacious. (noun)
They chose an interior colour scheme. (adjective)

definition: To enter a place or situation where you are not wanted or expected.
examples: We didn’t want to intrude on their meeting.
Noise from the street intruded on our sleep.

definition: To find the position of something; to set something in a particular place.
examples: We located the missing file on the server.
They located the new clinic near the station.

definition: A narrow way through or between things; a part of a written work; the act of moving from one place to another.
examples: We walked through a dark passage under the road.
Please read the passage on page ten.

extra.memory_tip: Passage = a place or piece you ‘pass’ through.

definition: A part or share of something; to divide and give out parts.
examples: She ate a small portion of cake. (noun)
Please portion the rice equally. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Portion = the part you ‘port’ to each person.

definition: Very valuable or important; much loved.
examples: The ring is made of precious metal.
Time with family is precious.

definition: A place where stone is dug from the ground; an animal being hunted; to take stone from the ground.
examples: The old quarry is now a lake. (noun)
Workers quarried limestone for the cathedral. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Quarry = query the earth for stone.

definition: A sloping surface that connects two different levels; to increase or build up.
examples: The building has a wheelchair ramp. (noun)
They will ramp up production before winter. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Ramp = a gentle rise to reach a level.

definition: Having a lot of space; roomy.
examples: The hall is bright and spacious.
They moved into a more spacious flat.

definition: The outside or top layer of something; on or near the outside; to come to the top or become known.
examples: Wipe the table surface before eating. (noun)
The dolphin surfaced beside the boat. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Surface = where air meets water, or outside meets inside.
